title: Science Content Development Project Utilizing Digital Humanities

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital tool proficiency and secondary science education experience
context.additional_context: A program for corporate science education leaders to strengthen practical competencies by collaboratively developing digital technology-based educational content using historical science data

learning_goals: Over 90% of participants can convert science history materials into digital content using digital tools (3D modeling, data visualization, etc.)
Each team can complete one digital exhibition prototype by analyzing science education history materials
Learners can submit at least three revised content proposals incorporating peer feedback via collaboration tools
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
